metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1709 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ByteArray::Get method in data/byte_array.cc in Google sfntly before 2016-06-10, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted SFNT font.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
